oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Intercropping cereals and grain legumes: a farmer’s perspective
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Prins, U.
Wit, J. de
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
Crop combinations and interactions
Weed management
Farm economics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Intercropping cereals and grain legumes show potential for organic agriculture in many ways. However, the use of land equivalent ratio (LER) as a measure for calculating the cropping advantage of intercrops over sole crops is too simple: neglecting weed suppression, yield reliability, grain quality, and minimum profitable yield, which are all relevant fac-tors from a farmer’s perspective. Only when the crop selection for the mixtures is carefully done, and crops are grown on the right soil in the right rotation, can intercropping be made to profit.
